data.title: Mag Talk - Weekly Shonen Magazine - News and Discussion
data.meta_description: I wonder if Arakawa new manga will be available on K Manga. It's such a shame we don't have a chance to read Atwight Game but this new one is sound more...
data.text:
I know it's a little late, but the information is interesting and fun.

The year 2023 has ended, and in this thread, I will show that he left Shonen Magazine last year.

From new series, to series that ended or were cancelled, their placement in the annual digital TOC, as well as a more accurate ranking of the Magazine's series performance.

Join me in this topic that I leave this magazine.

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024, Original Post Date: Jan 24, 2024 ---

Before starting, I clarify that all the information published is my property, from a hobby that I have been doing for a few years and I want to share with you.

Some information published may not be accurate, but I did it in the most professional and investigative way possible.

With that out of the way, let's get started.

*I took this image from the main page of Shonen Magazine, but it has no relation to the content of this thread.

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

Digital TOC

Although WSM, as far as I know, does not have an average system as demanding as Shonen Jump, in this case I made a list with that system to evaluate the average that each series had during its serialization.

In this average, the first 7 chapters for new series, Lead Color Pages and Color Pages were not counted, likewise, the absences or breaks that the series had this year are not taken into account.

It is also worth clarifying that this ranking is only based on the digital ranking of the magazine, the physical edition was not taken into account.

WSM 2023 Digital Ranking by average:

Mayonaka Heart Tune - 6*

Bakemonogatari - 7

Blue Lock - 7,47

Shangri - La Frontier - 8,55

Kanojo, Okarishimasu - 9,16

Edens Zero - 9,97

Kakkou no linazuke - 10,11

Mokushiroku no Yonkishi - 10,72

Hajime no Ippo - 11,16

Megami no Café Terrace - 11,80

Kuroiwa Medaka ni Watashi no Kawaii ga Tsujinai - 11,92

Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru - 12,14

Seitokai ni mo ana wa aru! - 12,25

Brave Bell - 12,31

Akabane Honeko no Bodyguard - 12,60

Kanojo mo Kanojo - 13,44

Kanan sama ha Akumade Choroi - 13,45

Ao no Miburo - 13,95

Amagami san Chi no Enmusubi - 14,92

Gachiakuta - 15,60

Yowayowa Sensei - 15,62

Kitazawa kun wa A - Class - 16,44

Sentai Daishikkaku - 17,05

Kiraboshi Ojou sama no Kyuukon - 17,67

Usayama Joshi Koukou 2-nen 1-gumi!! - 19,26

Dead Account - 19,5

KIMURAXCLASS - 19,85

Hinata san, Hoshino desu - 20,2

Atwight Game - 21,33

Fumetsu no Anata e - 22,76

Munin no Ichigeki - 24

**Mononoke no Ran - ?

**Jyushin no Katana - ?

***Ahiru no Sora - X

*Mayonaka Heart Tune only ranked 3 chapters

**Mononoke no Ran and Jyushin no Katana do not appear in the top because they are very recent series

***Ahiru no Sora did not publish any chapters this year, it is on hiatus.

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

Table of Chapters published by the magazine "WEEKLY SHONEN MAGAZINE" in 2023

I share with you a tracking table of all the series published in the year 2023 with their respective location in the TOC, position number, lead color pages, color pages, absences/breaks and hiatus.

*You can open the image in another tab and zoom

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

New Serializations/Completed/Cancelled/Transferred

Unlike 2022 where there were 12 new serializations, 2023 brought 7 new series of which Dead Account was transferred, KIMURAXCLASS and Usayama Joshi Koukou 2-nen 1-gumi!! they were canceled.

Mayonaka Heart Tune has already had its first volume reprinted and Jyushin no Katana is expected to be well received as it is from the author of Samurai Deeper Kyo.

New Series

Dead Account by Shizumu Watanabe (Real Account) - Issue #07

Usayama Joshi Koukou 2-nen 1-gumi!! by Suzumi Yuki (First Serialization) - Issue #20

Brave Bell by Meeb (Story) [Acma:Game] and Okane (Drawing) [First Serialization] - Issue #28

KIMURA X CLASS by Toru Kadoishi and Naha Doi (First Serialization) - Issue #30

Mayonaka Heart Tune by Masakuni Igarashi (Senryuu Shoujo) - Issue #42

Mononoke no Ran by Takeda Yousuke (First Serialization) - Issue #45

Jyushin no Katana by Kamijo Akimine (Samurai Deeper Kyo, Code: Breaker) - Issue #48

On the other hand, 2023 left the magazine without major series such as Bakemonogatari, Kanojo mo Kanojo and Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru, for the moment they have not had a stable replacement.

Ended / Axed Series

Muni no Ichigeki by Naito Koutaro. (22 Chapters) - Issue #06 - [Cancelled].

Bakemonogatari by Nisio Isin. (History) and Oh Great! (Art), (193 Chapters) - Edition #15 - [Finished]

Atwight Game by Naoshi Arakawa. (26 Chapters) - Issue #19 - [Cancelled]

Kanojo mo Kanojo by Hiroyuki. (144 Chapters) - Issue #25 - [Finished]

Kitazawa kun wa A - Class by Yumeno Tanuki (Art) and Monma Tsukasa (Story), (27 Chapters) - Issue #27 - [Cancelled]

Hinata san, Hoshino desu by Jun Kodama - Issue #34 - [Cancelled]

Kiraboshi Ojou sama no Kyuukon by Hideki - Issue #36 - #37 - [Cancelled]

Usayama Joshi Koukou 2-nen 1-gumi!! by Suzumi Yuki. (26 Chapters) - Issue #49 - [Cancelled]

Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru by Souichiro Yamamoto (255 Chapters) - Issue #50 - [Finished]

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

Physical Edition

Digital Edition

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

Lead Color Pages and Color Pages

I share two videos made by me, where all the lead color pages and Color Pages published in 2023:

Lead Color Pages:

Color Pages

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

Oricon Ranking 2023

Historic year for the magazine, for the first time since the Oricon era and since Kindaichi Shounen no Jikenbo in 1997, WSM has the best-selling series of the year in Japan.

Blue Lock achieves first place after selling 10,527,146 copies sold, consolidating the good moment that the manga has been going through. In addition, in 2024 there will be a movie and a second season adapting the best arc of the series. It is expected to continue to consolidate itself among the first places in Japan.

On the other hand, Tokyo卍Revengers with 3,218,117 copies sold, in addition to only having sold a single (and last) volume this year, manages to position itself in ninth place, a good way to withdraw from the Oricon tops, also consolidating itself as Shonen Magazine's best-selling series in the Oricon era.

For the other series, we will have to give some time while a more complete table is published.

I will place my bet on Shangri - La frontier and Blue Lock as the series that will appear in the magazine in 2024, and I think that Seitokai ni mo ana wa aru! will be the surprise.

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

Circulation of series that were published in 2023

There may be circulation errors

Hajime no Ippo: 100’000.000

*Nanatsu no Taizai / Mokushiroku no Yonkishi: 55’000.000

Blue Lock: 30’000.000

Ahiru no Sora: 24’000.000

Kanojo, Okarishimasu: 11’100.000

Shangri - La Frontier: 6’500.000

**Bakemonogatari: 2’800.000

Kanojo mo Kanojo: 2’000.000

**Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru: 1’700.000

Megami no Café Terrace: 1’400.000

Kuroiwa Medaka ni Watashi no Kawaii ga Tsujinai: 1’200.000

Amagami - san Chi no Enmusubi: 1’150.000

Seitokai ni mo ana wa aru! 600.000

***Edens Zero: 250.000

Kanan sama ha Akuma Choroi: 200.000

***Kakkou no linazuke: 100.000

If other series published in the magazine do not appear here, it is because their circulations have not yet been published until the moment this thread was made.

*Mokushiroku no Yonkishi, being the sequel of NnT, has not revealed its circulation separately but rather together, for this reason I put them together until there are separate figures.

** Bakemonogatari and Soredemo Ayumu wa Yosetekuru are out of circulation until their last volume, I haven't found them or they haven't been revealed yet.

***Edens Zero and Kakkou no linazuke only have figures for their first volumes, more information has not been revealed to date.

--- Double Post Merged, Jan 24, 2024 ---

WSM Historical Circulation until 2023

Unlike last year, this year there was only one big change in the top part of historical circulations of WSM magazine, Nanatsu no Taizai surpassed Daiya no Ace, Tsurikichi Sanpei, Shoot!, GTO and Devilman. Blue Lock, for its part, is already beginning to approach the top 10.

I share with you the top of the best-selling series in the history of the magazine (this is information that I have collected from different places, so it may be a little outdated or series may be missing):

Hajime no Ippo: 100’000.000

If you made it this far, thank you very much for reading , if life permits I will do my best to publish the year 2024 before the year ends
